imdb.plot outline: The writer José Revueltas was imprisoned for participating in the 1968 student movement. Arthur Miller, Pablo Neruda, Julio Cortazar and Gabriel García Márquez demanded the government to release him. However, José Revueltas, considered by Octavio Paz as one of the purest men in Mexico, was sentenced to sixteen years. For Revueltas, the world was a prison but his mission was to free the man, just as his Marxist devotion dictated, a devotion triggered by the search of God.
imdb.title: Las revueltas de José. Vida y obra de Revueltas 1914 - 1976
akas: Las revueltas de José. Vida y obra de Revueltas 1914 - 1976 (Mexico)
